info.title: Sao
info.description: Exposes CMS platform entry and score resources

get.description: List the ranked entries without their sources.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Any source code or input that should be compiled, executed or evaluated

get.description: Get the complete entry metadata (excluding the associated sources) for the given ID
List the results delimited and grouped by contest, task, entry or user identifier

parameters.name: ranked
parameters.description: List the ranked entries or the user tests

get.description:
Get complete result data for the given entry and testcase ID.
						The "re" and "ut" prefix delimits the entry type as "ranked entry" or "user test" respectively.
List all the scores delimited by the query params
List scores and its total grouped and filter by contest, task or user

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting order based on score value

get.description: Returns an specific score with the given entry and testcase ID

ComJossemargtSaoEntry.title: Mediatype identifier: application/vnd.com.jossemargt.sao.entry+json; view=default

contestSlug.description: Contest unique and human readble string identifier

href.description: API href for making requests on the entry

ranked.description:
Identifies if the entry should taken as a ranked entry or as an user test.
										 When omitted the value will be set to true, in other words any submited entry 
										 will be ranked (non user test) by deafult"

taskSlug.description: Task unique and human readable string identifier

ComJossemargtSaoEntry.description: Any source code or input to be compiled, executed and evaluated (default view)

ComJossemargtSaoEntryCollection.title: Mediatype identifier: application/vnd.com.jossemargt.sao.entry+json; type=collection; view=default
ComJossemargtSaoEntryCollection.description: ComJossemargtSaoEntryCollection is the media type for an array of ComJossemargtSaoEntry (default view)

Identifies if the entry should taken as a ranked entry or as an user test.
										 When omitted the value will be set to true, in other words any submited entry 
										 will be ranked (non user test) by deafult"

taskSlug.description: Task unique and human readable string identifier

CompilationResult.title: CompilationResult

wallClockTime.description: The spent execution human perceived time

CompilationResult.description: Embedded reprensentation of an entry compilation result

EntryPayload.title: EntryPayload

contestSlug.description: Contest unique and human readble string identifier

ranked.description:
Identifies if the entry should taken as a ranked entry or as an user test.
										 When omitted the value will be set to true, in other words any submited entry 
										 will be ranked (non user test) by deafult"

sources.description:
Source files representation. Within this list the source code files and input files can be 
						  sent alike.

taskSlug.description: Task unique and human readable string identifier

EntryPayload.description: Any source code or input that should be compiled, executed or evaluated

EntrySource.title: EntrySource

language.description:
Identifies the programming language used in the entry's content. The special
										  keyword "none" should be used instead when submitting plain text, which are 
										  used for user test inputs and  diff based grading

name.description:
Source file name including its extension. This field's value should comply with the 
									  name format constraint declared by the task resource. Taking the "batch.%l" format
                                      as example, the valid source code file names could be "batch.py", "batch.cpp" or "batch.js"

EntrySource.description: Entry's embed type which represents a source file

EvaluationResult.title: EvaluationResult
EvaluationResult.description: Embedded reprensentation of an entry evaluation result

ExecutionResult.title: ExecutionResult

wallClockTime.description: The spent execution human perceived time

ExecutionResult.description: Embedded reprensentation of an entry execution result

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: Value of ID must be an integer

id.description: a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

example.detail: Value of ID must be an integer
